page.title: 02ECOLOGY - Heathland
page.content: At{South Weirs}there are four clear bands of vegetation - close to the houses{grassland}then westward a belt of{heath,,one of bracken and {grass and finally heath with major {clumps of gorse. Samples in the heath gave 38% ling, 27% cross leaved heather and 25% various grasses at one site and 52% ling, 42% various grasses and 6% cross leaved heather at another. In the bracken area 120 bracken plants were underlain by 20% grass cover and the remainder bracken litter in 1 sq metre. A more open site had 29% bracken litter. Between Cater's Cottage and the Marlpit Oak a sample showed grasses 40%, white heather 31%, gorse 16%, purple heather 5% and cross leaved heather 8%. 8 grazing ponies were seen.
